Good afternoon, POB Families,
You should have received an email from POBSchools about Portal Day. If not, please be sure to check that the District has your correct contact email.

Over the past week, we have recreated two new master schedules for our K-12 in-person and remote learners. This task was a monumental one due to the following factors:

-Students moving to remote instruction across 13 grades;
-Teachers needing remote options due to health issues;
-Alpha-balancing in grades 7-12 after remote students were removed from in-person classes; and,
-Hiring new staff for the additional sections created in K-6, and for K-12 remote sections.

The Portal will open today as follows:
K-4 at 3 PM
5-8 at 4 PM
9-12 at 5 PM

Please note there will be fluctuations on teacher assignments due to the aforementioned factors. Our administrators will be in their offices on Monday to assist with any questions.

We are also installing more hand sanitizers throughout the buildings. Additional cleaning measures have been put in place, and all health teachers will address the importance of hand washing to reduce the spread of germs during the flu season.

We will continue to employ best practices in the interest of having safe and healthy schools.

Sincerely,
Dr. Lorna R. Lewis

post_text: The Trustees of the Plainview-Old Bethpage Board of Education would like to invite you to attend a Community Forum led by our search consultants, District Wise Search Consultants. Your input will be valuable to us while we create a “profile” for our next Superintendent. The Community Forum will be held on Thursday, November 7th from 7-8 in the POB JFK HS cafeteria. The participation of the community and students is very important during this process. All information gathered will be included anonymously in a report that will be prepared for the Board. We hope you can make it on November 7th. For those unable to attend the meeting, or who prefer to provide their suggestions and opinions privately, a confidential e-mail address has been established by the consultants… pobsup@districtwisesearch.com. This address will accept e-mails until November 25th for inclusion in the report. Any e-mails received after this date will be forwarded anonymously to the Board of Education.

If you have any questions, we encourage you to reach out to building administration at the high school.

It is with great pleasure that we are announcing that every spring varsity interscholastic athletic team earned the distinction of NYSPHSAA Scholar Athlete Team. This award is given to any varsity athletic team having 75% of their roster with accumulative GPA of 90 or higher.

In addition to our team’s academic success, 73% of our varsity student athletes received the NYSPHSAA Individual Scholar Athlete Award. This award is given to any varsity student athlete with a 90 GPA or higher.

This award is a great achievement for any interscholastic athletic team and demonstrates a true commitment to education from our student athletes, coaches, teachers and support staff. Go Hawks !!
